name: df-hlat
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(chlt, crab(s0, cin(cin(coml, ccla), clc), wa(wral(s1, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wral(s2, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wi(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wrex(s3, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), w3a(wne(cv(s3), cv(s1)), wne(cv(s3), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))))), wrex(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wa(wbr(cfv(cp0, cv(s0)), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s2))), wa(wbr(cv(s2), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cfv(cp1, cv(s0)))))))))))
comment: Define the class of Hilbert lattices, which are complete, atomic lattices satisfying the superposition principle and minimum height. (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)
